results.title: Printer light play
results.brief_description: A study on the technical properties of film colour. Shot on Eastman colour negative, the film records a variety of combinations of the printer lights, blue, red and green, thus creating different colour effects with the subject, a boy holding a Kodak colour control card.

results.title: Experiments in three colour separation
results.brief_description: A documentary of the work of Arthur and Corinne Cantrill since 1975 in 3-colour separation. Discusses the classic theories and principles in 3-colour separation in film and photography. Commentary by Arthur Cantrill.
results.description: A documentary of the work of Arthur and Corinne Cantrill since 1975 in 3-colour separation. Discusses the classic theories and principles in 3-colour separation in film and photography. Commentary by Arthur Cantrill.

results.title: [Malcolm : publicity kit]
results.brief_description: Publicity kit for the production Malcolm (1986), including 6 B&W Stills (Large), 12 35mm Colour Transparencies, 5 Press Kit/ Reviews, 2 B&W Negatives, 1 Colour Negative Strip, 1 Cast and crew list

results.title: A Year to Remember 1953
results.brief_description: Collection of newsreel footage which made up Australia’s history in 1953 - Deaths of Stalin and Queen Mary - Coronation of Queen Elizabeth II - US Vice President Nixon visits Australia - Testing of the Jindivik at Woomera - Mt Everest conquered by Sir Edmund Hillary and Tensing - Anzac Day in Korea - Exchange of POW’s - Express train crash in New Zealand - Davis Cup wins by Lew Hoad and Ken Rosewall - Ben Hogan wins British Open … and much more. Rated: G

results.title: Underbelly
results.brief_description: Underbelly explores the dark undercurrent of the city and the unconcious mind. Underbelly is the place between asleep and awake, where a shadow helps you navigate the quiet city streets.
results.description: Underbelly explores the dark undercurrent of the city and the unconcious mind. Underbelly is the place between asleep and awake, where a shadow helps you navigate the quiet city streets.

results.title: Melbourne
results.brief_description:
Unedited footage of Melbourne including people relaxing in a ‘garden’ in the city. Odd moment halfway through where an Aboriginal man (Jagajaga?) signs his name on an official-looking document

Contains an excellent ‘The End’ that features a watercolour image of Melbourne city overlooking the Yarra and towards St. Paul’s Cathederal.

results.title: Pop-Up Television Radio Model TR-475U
results.material_description: plastic body with silver metal handle, trim and antenna.
results.brief_description:
National Transistor TV. Model TR-475U. Pop-up screen and pull out handle for portablity.
No power cords, batteries only.

Brand: National

Serial no. F 3 (??) 1113
TQF8125

National Transistor TV
Model TR-475U DC12V 11W
Matsushita Electric Industrial Co. Ltd
Made in Japan
TBM 81685

Caution: To prevernt electric shock, do not remove cover. No user-serviceable parts inside, and pilot lamp soldered in place. Refer servicing to qualified service personnel.

Note: Before opening the pop-up portion of this TV. Please release two red screws fixed on the bottom side of the set. These screws are fixed for delivery safety only. The battery enclosed in this TV receiver is disconnected to assure longer life.

Before use, it must be properly connected. Please see instruction manual. For longer battery life: charge more than 10 hours before initial use. After each use once a month.

There are no power cords accompanying the TV.
results.description:
The National Transistor TV Radio Model TR-475U is a battery-operated, portable model features an inbuilt radio and a ‘pop-up’ television screen.
National was a brand used by Panasonic Corporation sell home appliances, personal appliances, and industrial appliances. The National brand operated in Australia until 1988 when it transferred to The Panasonic Corporation.
